articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Gifts to KCU Delegates
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Gifts to KCU Delegates
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un showed again such loving care as sending gifts to all the delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU).
					 The anniversary was celebrated with splendor as a grand festival unprecedented in history amid deep concern and blessings of the Workers' Party of Korea, the state and all the Korean people.
					
					 A gift-conveying ceremony took place at the April 25 Hotel Friday.
					
					 Ri Yong Su, department director of the WPK Central Committee, made a speech for conveying the gifts.
					
					 The speaker said that the delegates are deeply moved by the loving care becoming bigger as the days go by, adding that no generation in the world is as happy as the schoolchildren in the DPRK who are under the care of the dear respected Kim Jong Un as he sent gifts of love to the delegates.  
					
					 He called upon them to study hard for the DPRK under the uplifted slogan of "Ready Always for Socialist Country!" to become proud and admirable children of Songun Korea who bring only pleasure to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The delegates who received gifts were determined to prepare themselves to be competent revolutionary talents and pillars of powerful Korea who have knowledge, morality and strong physique.

articles.title: Agreement on Cooperation and Exchange of Delegations Signed between WPK and LPRP
articles.content:
Agreement on Cooperation and Exchange of Delegations Signed between WPK and LPRP
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- An agreement on cooperation and exchange of delegations was signed between the Workers' Party of Korea and the Lao People's Revolutionary Party in Vientiane on Thursday.
					 Present at its signing ceremony from the DPRK side were members of the WPK delegation led by Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, and Han Pong Ho, DPRK ambassador to Laos, and from the Lao side Vice Prime Minister and Foreign Minister Thongloun Sisoulith, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the LPRP who is also chairman of its Committee for External Affairs, Sounthon Sayachak, member of the C.C., the LPRP who is also vice-chairman of its Committee for External Affairs and vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of Laos, and other officials concerned.
					
					 Kim and Sisoulith signed the agreement.

articles.title: Socialist Cause in DPRK Sure to Be Accomplished: Lao President
articles.content:
Socialist Cause in DPRK Sure to Be Accomplished: Lao President
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The DPRK with a solid economic foundation and potential will successfully accomplish the cause of building a thriving socialist nation.
					 President of Laos Choummaly Sayasone who is general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party said this on Thursday when receiving a delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, on a visit to Laos.
					
					 He recalled that leader Kim Jong Il performed undying exploits for the country and its people.
					
					 He expressed conviction that the socialist cause in the DPRK is sure to be accomplished because the dear respected Kim Jong Un has creditably carried forward the cause of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Lao president wished Kim Jong Un greater success in his noble work.

articles.title: Senior Lao Party Official Refers to Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Senior Lao Party Official Refers to Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Boun Thong Chitmani, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee and chairman of the Control Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, Thursday met a delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) led by Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, on a visit to Laos.
					 The chairman extended warm congratulations to the dear respected Kim Jong Un on his election as first secretary of the WPK and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					
					 The traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and countries provided by Kaysone Phomvihane and President Kim Il Sung have grown stronger generation after generation, he said.

articles.title: Talks between Delegations of WPK and LPRP Held
articles.content:
Talks between Delegations of WPK and LPRP Held
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the Lao People's Revolutionary Party (LPRP) took place in Vientiane on Thursday.
					 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were members of the WPK delegation led by Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, and DPRK Ambassador to Laos Han Pong Ho and from the Lao side Vice Prime Minister and Foreign Minister Thongloun Sisoulith, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the LPRP who is also chairman of its Committee for External Affairs, Sounthon Sayachak, member of the C.C., the LPRP who is also the vice-chairman of its Committee for External Affairs and vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of Laos, and others.
					
					 At the talks the two sides informed each other of their party activities and exchanged views on the issue of developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and on matters of mutual concern.
					
					 Thongloun Sisoulith extended warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un upon his election as first secretary of the WPK and first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					
					 He noted with pleasure that the WPK and the Korean people have made great achievements in the defence of the country and in the work for the building of a thriving socialist nation and improving the people's living standard. 
					
					 He fully supported the WPK and the Korean people in their struggle to build a thriving socialist nation and achieve the peaceful reunification of the country under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The LPRP is attaching great importance to the exchange and cooperation with the WPK, he said, expressing his will to joint actions in the international arena.
					
					 The talks proceeded in a comradely and friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Greetings to Swedish King
articles.content:
Greetings to Swedish King
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a congratulatory message to Swedish King Carl ⅩⅥ Gustaf on June 6 on the occasion of the national day of the Kingdom of Sweden.
					 Kim in the message wished the Swedish people prosperity.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A friendship delegation headed by An Kuk Thae, chairman of the South Phyongan Provincial People's Committee, returned home on Friday after visiting Amur Region of Russia.
					 Johannes Plug, member of the Bundestag of Germany from the Social-Democratic Party, and his party departed here for home on the same day.

articles.title: Unhasu Orchestra Concert on KCU Anniversary Goes on
articles.content:
Unhasu Orchestra Concert on KCU Anniversary Goes on
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A concert "Love the Future!" given by the Unhasu Orchestra to mark the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) is going on before full house everyday.
					 Pyongyangites appreciated the concert Friday.
					
					 Among them were parents of the KCU delegates, teachers and students of primary and secondary schools, instructors of the KCU, officials of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, working people, overseas Koreans and foreign guests.
					
					 The concert began with the playing of the national anthem. 
					
					 Put on the stage were colorful numbers singing praises of the benvolence shown by the peerlessly great men for the younger generation, putting forward the children as future of Korea, successors to the Korean revolution and kings of the country.
					
					 The performers lauded the undying feats of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who dedicated themselves to the prosperity of the country, people's happiness and bright future of the rising generation with noble outlook on them.
					
					 They successfully represented the history of the KCU that has bravely fought for the country and the people by carrying forward the traditions of the anti-Japanese Children's Corps. They also reflected the bright and cheerful schoolchildren who are stoutly growing to be the happy children in the era of Songun under the loving care of the sun.
					
					 The concert ended with epilogue juvenile chorus "Let's Learn for Korea", poem and song "Love the Future" and chorus "March of Children's Union." It was acclaimed by the audience for its high ideological value and artistry.

articles.title: KCU Delegates Deeply Impressed by Concert, Performances
articles.content:
KCU Delegates Deeply Impressed by Concert, Performances
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- A concert "Love the Future!" was given by the Unhasu Orchestra in Pyongyang on Wednesday, the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU).
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un appreciated the concert together with KCU delegates.
					
					 Jon Sin Phyong (13), a KCU delegate from Kogae Secondary School in Manpho City, Jagang Province, told KCNA:
					
					 "I could hardly keep back my tears, seeing pictures of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il displayed on screen. They had shown loving care for children, calling them the kings of the country.
					
					 I will become a true juvenile revolutionary, a juvenile guard creditably carrying forward the revolutionary cause under the guidance of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, identical to the Generalissimos."
					
					 Hwang Un Jong (12), a KCU delegate from Phungsan Secondary School in Kim Hyong Gwon County, Ryanggang Province, said:
					
					 "'Song of Juvenile Guerrilla' and 'I Answered My Younger Sister's Question' are my favorite songs.
					
					 I will be a true juvenile revolutionary and a juvenile guard in the era of Songun as desired by the dear respected Kim Jong Un."
					
					 Meanwhile, a joint performance was given at the People's Theatre by the National Symphony Orchestra, Pyongyang Music School and art group members of the Pyongyang Students and Children's Palace.
					
					 After enjoying the performance, Ryang Pom Hyang (10), a KCU delegate from Orang Primary School in Orang County, North Hamgyong Province, said:
					
					 "I've never seen such a magnificent theatre. All performance numbers deeply impressed me.
					
					 I'll prepare myself to be a reliable pillar of socialist Korea by doing well at study and organizational life and thus live up to the loving care and trust shown by the dear respected Kim Jong Un."
					
					 KCU delegates also enjoyed a performance given by the Mansudae Art Troupe and Pyongyang Puppet Company.

articles.title: KCU Delegates Visit National House of Class Education
articles.content:
KCU Delegates Visit National House of Class Education
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Delegates to the celebrations of the 66th birthday of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) have visited the National House of Class Education. 
					 The house exhibits historical data and materials showing brutal atrocities committed by the U.S. and Japanese imperialists as well as the class enemies against the Korean people.
					
					 The visitors hardly repress their surging indignation at the brutalities and vowed revenge upon the enemies.
					
					 Hong Sok Song (12), a delegate from Yangsi Secondary School in Ryongchon County, North Phyongan Province, told KCNA:
					
					 "I could understand more clearly about the crime-woven history made by the U.S. and Japanese imperialists.
					
					 They and the Lee Myung Bak group of south Korea are now carrying on anti-DPRK war drills.
					
					 I will join the army in the future to become a-match-for-a hundred soldier."
					
					 Kim Chong Hyang (13), a delegate from Sinhung Secondary School in Sinchon County, South Hwanghae Province, said:
					
					 "I heard many stories about atrocities committed by the U.S. invaders during their temporary occupation of my hometown in the period of the Korean War (1950-1953).
					
					 The visit to this house hardens my determination to wreak revenge upon them on all accounts."
					
					 O Hyon Mi, KCU instructor at Namha Primary School in Sinuiju City, North Phyongan Province, said:
					
					 "The visit reminds me of the truth that struggle will continue as long as the class enemies are left alive.
					
					 The Lee group defamed the KCU celebrations as "charade intentionally orchestrated" and "event for winning public favor" and furthermore insulted the dignity of our supreme leadership, likening it to the Nazis.
					
					 All the KCU delegates are now seized with surging resentment toward the provokers. We delegates strongly asked the Korean People's Army to shower deadly fire of revenge upon them at once, as was declared in the ultimatum released by the KPA General Staff.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors will never escape from stern punishment."

articles.title: KCU Delegates' Impressions and Resolve Carried in Letters
articles.content:
KCU Delegates' Impressions, Resolve Carried in Their Letters
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) have written in their letters impressions they got during their stay in Pyongyang, as well as their resolve.
					 The letters deal with the special favor and loving care shown by the dear respected Kim Jong Un for them.
					
					 Pak Nam Hyok, a delegate from Songrim Secondary School in Chongjin City, North Hamgyong Province, in a letter to his teacher said:
					
					 "When I was leaving for Pyongyang amid warm welcome of my teachers and classmates, I had no idea that we could enjoy such great happiness and high honor.
					
					 To my regret, I can not express in this letter all of what I felt at that happy time.
					
					 I could hardly go to sleep all night when I received a delegate certificate to be kept as an heirloom. 
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un attended the joint national meeting of the Korean Children's Union organizations on the 66th KCU anniversary and joined us delegates in appreciating a concert given by the Unhasu Orchestra.
					
					 All these facts seem to me like a dream. 
					
					 He is, indeed, our benevolent father as he has cultivated the garden of love for the future in this land with Kim Jong Il's patriotism based on the noble outlook on posterity.
					
					 All these happy days will be always kept in my memory."
					
					 Kim Hyon Ho, a delegate from Wonchang Secondary School in Sonchon County, North Phyongan Province, said in a letter to his father:
					
					 "When visiting the statues of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill, I told them about the honor of my family.
					
					 We delegates visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun and Generalissimo Kim Il Sung's old home in Mangyongdae and had a pleasant time in the Amusement Park in Kaeson Youth Park.
					
					 Then we took tray-noodle mixed with minced meat at Okryu Restaurant."
					
					 Kim Su Jong, a delegate from Oksu Secondary School in Taesan District, Nampho, wrote in a letter to her classmates: 
					
					 "The dear respected Kim Jong Un posed for a souvenir picture with the KCU delegates, including me. We burst into 'Hurrah', looking up to him, who bestowed great honor to us.
					
					 He said in his congratulatory speech that the features of thriving Korea in the future would be drawn on report cards of the KCU members before anything else.
					
					 It is my call that you and I, as members of the Children's Union founded and developed by Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, should do better at study and organizational life to display the dignity of our country to the whole world, always keeping his teachings in our mind."

articles.title: KCU Delegates Write Diaries
articles.content:
KCU Delegates Write Diaries
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) wrote down in their diaries their impressions of the events held on the KCU birthday.
					 Kim Ye Song, a pupil at Pyongyang Sinri Primary School, said in her diary:
					
					 "Today marks the KCU birthday. I have too many things to write about today full of happiness and glory.
					
					 First of all, I would like to say that we are the luckiest children in the world.
					
					 As we were waiting for the time to start the joint national meeting of KCU organizations at Kim Il Sung Stadium, the dear respected Kim Jong Un, whom we, schoolchildren, had so eagerly wanted to see even in a dream, appeared in the rostrum with a board smile on his face.
					
					 I could hardly believe this fact and pinched myself to see if it is real."
					
					 Choe Nam Il, a student from Rasok Secondary School in Chongam District, Chongjin City, North Hamgyong Province, said in his diary:
					
					 "The dear respected Kim Jong Un in his congratulatory speech called us 'My beloved comrades, all members of the Children's Union!' several times.
					
					 We were so much touched by that.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un, thank you very much."
					
					 Kim Kum Sun, a student from Kangryong Secondary School in Kangnam County, Pyongyang, said in her diary:
					
					 "I was honored to see the dear respected Kim Jong Un two times today.
					
					 He joined us in appreciating the concert given by the Unhasu Orchestra, after attending the joint meeting together with us.
					
					 I was in excitement during the concert. When it was over, all those present gathered around him with stormy cheers. He acknowledged our cheers by waving his hand.
					
					 Kim Jong Un is really the eternal sun for all of us. The happy day passed like an arrow.
					
					 With this honor and glory deep in my mind, I firmly resolved to be better at study and organizational life and thus become a patriot and a hero who will glorify Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's Korea."

articles.title: DPRK Hopes for Good Results in 2012 London Olympiad
articles.content:
DPRK Hopes for Good Results in 2012 London Olympiad
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea aims to clinch more medals than before in the upcoming 30th London Olympics, a sports expert told KCNA.
					 49 DPRK players (35 women, 14 men) are qualified for 2012 London Olympics in 11 events, including women's football, marathon, table-tennis, wrestling and weightlifting.
					
					 The DPRK pins its hopes on weightlifting and wrestling in particular.
					
					 Women's football is also hopeful. The women footballers are now undergoing hard training to get a good result in the Olympics.
					
					 The DPRK won four gold medals in the 25th Olympiad and two gold medals in the 26th and 29th Olympic Games respectively.

articles.title: Stop to Coloring Racket Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Stop to Coloring Racket Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Pak Ji Won, chairman of the Emergency Measure Committee of the opposition Democratic United Party of south Korea, demanded the "government" authorities stop the coloring racket on Wednesday, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 He accused Lee Myung Bak of talking about "forces following the north" and Park Geun Hye of the "Saenuri Party" of inciting split and conflict through a coloring racket, terming these behaviors anachronistic.
					
					 He declared his party would not allow the corrupt power and the daughter of a dictator to behave as they please to meet their interests.

articles.title: Koreans in Russia Criticize Japan's Claim to Tok Islets
articles.content:
Koreans in Russia Criticize Japan's Claim to Tok Islets
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Russia held a meeting in Moscow Wednesday to denounce Japan for its ambition to grab Tok Islets.
					 Present there were representatives of the United Confederation of Koreans in Russia, the All-Russia Federation of Koreans and other compatriots organizations and other Koreans and experts of the Russian Institute of History, the Institute of the Far East and the Institute of Oriental Studies under the Russian Academy of Sciences and other scientific research organs.
					
					 A keynote speech was followed by other speeches at the meeting.
					
					 The speakers asserted Tok Islets have belonged to Korea from the time immemorial.
					
					 A statement was issued there.
					
					 Japan is becoming evermore desperate in its moves to seize Tok Islets, the statement said, adding:
					
					 It is known well to everybody that the islets have been part of the inalienable territory of Korea since the olden times and there is no ground for Japan to insist that they belong to Japan. This issue was proved by many historical documents and international law and this is little short of a permanent confirmation.
					
					 However, the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan declared in the revised school textbooks "dominium" over Tok Islets in the East Sea of Korea, the statement noted, and continued:
					
					 Japan marked the islets as "Takeshima" of Japan in its textbooks in a bid to give impression that the islets belong to Japan.
					
					 This touched off bitter anger among Koreans in Russia, it held, voicing strong opposition to Japan's ambition to grab the islets.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Politics of Love and Trust Praised by Bulgarian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Politics of Love and Trust Praised by Bulgarian Organization
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association issued its bulletin No. 4 on the occasion of the 48th anniversary of the leader Kim Jong Il's start of the work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The bulletin carried articles illustrated with a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il.
					
					 In an article titled "For the people" the bulletin said that he was a statesman who pursued politics based on love and trust for the people.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 His love for the people reached all places where they live.
					
					 Worksites and families visited by him can be easily found everywhere in the DPRK. When the whole country grieved over the demise of President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il, more saddened by his demise than anyone else, let a plane fly for new born triplets. This story is told as a legend.
					
					 In an article titled "The way chosen by the DPRK" it said:
					
					 Which way the DPRK will follow after the demise of Kim Jong Il?
					
					 As a reply to this question of world's concern, there rings out from this country the declaration that it will take to the last the road of independence, the road of Songun and the road of socialism explored by Kim Il Sung, the father of socialist Korea, and carried forward by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The DPRK will never step back from the road of independence.
					
					 It will keep to the road of socialism to the last.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Given Publicity in Italy, Ethiopia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Given Publicity in Italy, Ethiopia
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Songun Idea in Fermo of Italy on May 29 posted on the Internet website of the Korean Friendship Association the full texts of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's works "Let's Dynamically Struggle for a Final Victory, Holding Aloft the Banner of Songun" and "Let Us Hold Great Comrade Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as General Secretary of Our Party Forever and Successfully Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche."
					 The work "Let's Dynamically Struggle for a Final Victory, Holding Aloft the Banner of Songun", published on April 15, 2012, clarifies the 100-year history of Kim Il Sung's nation proved clearly the immutable truth that outstanding leaders assure the dignity and prosperity of the country and nation.
					
					 It expounds the idea that the ever-victorious history of the Korean People's Army has assured the glorious 100-year history of Juche Korea and that it will provide a sure guarantee for the eternal history of Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea.
					
					 It sets forth the tasks to be fulfilled to demonstrate the dignity of Songun Korea for all ages and successfully carry out the cause of building a thriving socialist country.
					
					 The work "Let Us Hold Great Comrade Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as General Secretary of Our Party Forever and Successfully Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche", published on April 6, 2012, clarifies that it is a principled requirement for the victorious advance of the Korean revolution to hold leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea. It indicates the tasks for steadily developing the WPK into the glorious party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea on May 29 carried Kim Jong Un's work "On Effecting a Drastic Turn in Land Management to Meet the Requirements for Building a Thriving Socialist Nation" in its bulletin No. 37.
					
					 The work, published on April 27, 2012, clarifies the undying exploits performed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in land management and indicates the general orientation and tasks for face-lifting the country's land as befitting a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: DPRK's Self-Defensive Step Supported by British Organizations
articles.content:
DPRK's Self-Defensive Step Supported by British Organizations
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association issued a joint statement on May 23 in support of the answer given by a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry.
					 The DPRK's satellite launch was totally aimed for peaceful purposes and opened to the world media and, therefore, there was no ground for the G-8 summit to take issue with it, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Many countries have launched satellites into space, not being called into question at the G-8 summit. Eight countries have launched satellites.
					
					 Therefore, there is no justification for G-8 to pull up the DPRK over its nuclear deterrent.
					
					 As the DPRK has already declared, it is hypocritical for the U.S. and other countries which had access to nuclear weapons and conducted nuclear tests to talk about the DPRK's nuclear tests.
					
					 The hostile policy toward the DPRK pursued by the U.S. from before the Korean War compelled the DPRK to have access to nuclear deterrent.
					
					 We will as ever positively support the stand of the DPRK to continue bolstering up its nuclear deterrent and take self-defensive step, it concluded.

articles.title: Lectures on DPRK Given in Guinea,Indonesia
articles.content:
Lectures on DPRK Given in Guinea, Indonesia
 Pyongyang, June 8 (KCNA) -- Lectures were given in Guinea and Indonesia on June 1 on the occasion of the 48th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The chief of the Guinean Group for the Study of February 16 Art in a lecture titled "The man who believed in people as in Heaven" cited facts to prove that Kim Jong Il regarded it as his maxim to believe in people as in Heaven all his life and gave top priority to the convenience of the people and did not allow even the slightest practice contrary to it.
					
					 He deemed it as the greatest affair and the highest goal to improve the standard of people's living and always provided field guidance for translating their ideal into reality, the chief noted.
					
					 The manager of Millenia Armada Express Company of Indonesia noted in a lecture titled "Eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea" that Kim Jong Il developed the WPK into an invincible steel-strong party by successfully carrying forward President Kim Il Sung's cause of party building for nearly half a century.
					
					 The Korean people are now waging a dynamic struggle to strengthen the party and build a thriving nation under the outstanding leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, holding in high esteem Kim Jong Il as eternal general secretary of the WPK, the manager stressed.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia regalos a los delegados de la ONC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia regalos a los delegados de la ONC
Pyongyang, 8 de junio (ACNC) -- Todos los delegados de la Organizacion de Ninos de Corea, que celebraron el dia 6 de junio como la gran fiesta sin precedente en la historia bajo la profunda atencion y bendicion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el Estado, recibieron otra vez la gran benevolencia del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un.
					El envio regalos a todos los delegados participantes en las festividades por el 66o aniversario de la fundacion de la Organizacion de Ninos de Corea.
					
					Tuvo lugar el dia 8 en el Hotel 25 de Abril la ceremonia de entrega  de los presentes.
					
					El jefe de departamento del Comite Central del PTC Ri Yong Su pronuncio el discurso de entrega.
					
					El orador dijo que no hay en este mundo la generacion tan feliz como los ninos escolares de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea que viven en el regazo del Maximo Dirigente.
					
					Subrayo que para darle solo la alegria al Maximo Dirigente, los ninos deben estudiar con afan bajo la consigna "!Siempre listos para la patria socialista!"
					
					Los delegados recibidos el regalo juran preparar como potente talento revolucionario y sosten de la Corea prospera, listos a ricos conocimientos, nobles virtudes y buena salud.

articles.title: Se ofrecen por todo lo alto las funciones para delegados de la ONC
articles.content:
Se ofrecen por todo lo alto las funciones para delegados de la ONC
Pyongyang, 8 de junio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar solemnemente el dia 6 en esta capital el concierto de la Orquesta Unhasu "!Amen el futuro!", dedicado al 66o aniversario de la fundacion de la Organizacion de Ninos de Corea (ONC).
					Esta por las nubes el humor de los delegados de la ONC que tuvieron el honor de presenciarlo con el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un.
					
					En entrevista con la ACNC, Jon Sin Phyong (13 anos de edad), alumno de la Escuela Secundaria de Kogae de la ciudad de Manpho de la provincia de Jagang, dijo asi:
					
					Durante la funcion, me invadio el sentimiento de anoranza a los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y       Kim Jong Il quienes nos amaban calidamente llamandonos reyes del pais.
					
					Ese inmenso amor lo vierte hoy a nosotros el General Kim Jong Un. Sere verdadero revolucionario y guardia infantil de la epoca del Songun para dar firme continuidad a la revolucion siguiendo al General.
					
					Hwang Un Jong (12 anos de edad), alumna de la Escuela Secundaria de Phungsan del distrito        Kim Hyong Gwon de la provincia de Ryanggang:
					
					Cante siguiendo la voz de los artistas.
					
					Me gustaron mucho la "Cancion de guerrilla infantil" y "Conteste a la pregunta de mi hermana".
					
					Me preparare como personal competente revolucionario de la Corea prospera que tenga ricos conocimientos, nobles virtudes y buena salud.
					
					Luego de ver las funciones de la Orquesta Sinfonica Nacional, la Escuela de Musica de Pyongyang y los miembros del grupo artistico del Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Pyongyang, Ryang Pom Hyang (10 anos de edad), alumna de la Escuela Primaria de Orang del distrito homonimo de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte, declaro a la ACNC como sigue:
					
					Nunca he visto antes las funciones tan excelentes como estas.
					
					En el asiento de espectador, me senti realmente contenta y feliz.
					
					Me dejaron muy impresionada todos los programas de esos espectaculos.
					
					Recompensare el amor y la confianza del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un con estudiar y militar bien en la ONC y prepararme como trabajadora fidedigna de la Corea socialista.
					
					Los delegados de la ONC disfrutaron igualmente las funciones del Conjunto Artistico Mansudae y el Conjunto de Funcion de Titeres de Pyongyang.

articles.title: Deportistas coreanos aspiran a llevarse mas medallas olimpicas
articles.content:
Deportistas coreanos aspiran a llevarse mas medallas olimpicas
Pyongyang, 8 de junio (ACNC) -- En exclusiva con la ACNC, un funcionario de la rama deportiva de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea dijo que los deportistas coreanos se propusieron ganar mas medallas en los proximos XXX Juegos Olimpicos en comparacion con las anteriores ediciones.
					Hasta la fecha, se clasificaron para la magna cita estival 49 deportistas de la RPDC (35 muchachas y 14 varones) en 11 disciplinas como futbol femenino, maraton, ping-pong, lucha y levantamiento de pesas.
					
					Se cifra gran esperanza en los pesistas, los luchadores y las futbolistas.
					
					Convencidos de su victoria, ellos intensifican el entrenamiento para mejorar sus condiciones fisicas, tecnicas y tacticas.
					
					La RPDC conquisto 4 medallas de oro en los XXV Juegos Olimpicos de 1992 y 2 preseas de oro en los XXVI y XXIX, respectivamente.
